Yes please came to post the same thing about stone cutters and stone + deepslate.

Either that or let the stone cutter turn stone and deepslate into the same fancy shapes that it can do for cobbled stone and cobbled deepslate.

Agreed. Or maybe the frog doesn't drop the light immediately and instead you have to wait a little while for the frog to... digest it's meal

Maybe the frog can release some sort of magma mucus after it eats a magma cube and that can craft a froglight with four glass surrounding it, though itâ€™ll take a while since the frog needs to digest it. Also it drops as an item after the process and the frog will croak to alert you itâ€™s finished digestion.

Just a concept
Good idea!
I feel this is very needed i was just building a base and I really wanted to use calcite stairs, but nope, they don't exist
Could also put lightning in a bottle.... or fireflies.
that has no logic fire needs air!
Honestly, I totally forgot about fireflies in a jar, but I think that this could work out too. Also, Minecraft isn't 100% realistic so I am sure they wouldn't burn out.

Vanilla Tweaks, offers a very nice resource pack that makes the pumpkin stem more orange, but I agree they should be different, even if they just change the leaves and color a little bit it could be more pleasing and a little easer to work with.

This should be implemented already. It really makes no sense why they'd have them look the same, and I've had to use f3 to see which one is which while playing, so i dont break the wrong one. @vanilla tweeks reply, we shouldn't need a resource pack for this simple thing that should be in the game to begin with
This idea is great btw

Could also add in a "tile" look as well, honestly is my favorite variant of deepslate and love to see how other blocks would look with that baseline small brick texture to give a lot of pattern to a single block.

It is possible that the texture of the candle is closer to the wick more brown, if is there soul sand. Crafting recipe can either come true when first crafted or fuse the candle with soul sand/soil. Of course, there must be everything that the existing fire of souls has: piglins are afraid, weaker lighting

Ta chido
It works on Crimson/Warped Nylium, so why not?
I think this would be an appropriate late-game advancement to make farming of mushrooms easier for potion ingredients. I don't feel it should be biome restricted either, as the nether nylium isn't.
cool idea! are opals included?
would love to see tin ore to Be combined with copper to make bronze used to craft weapons, tools and armour. durability somewhere between stone and iron
Good idea, but won''t the moss block (also from the lush caves) look green no matter where it is?
Hayy
something like this pleaaaaase, let me build lush walled gardens in my deserts
another reasonable idea would be some kind of fertiliser that will cover a 2x2 area of grass and that you would have to apply to make it a more vibrant shade (i just wanna be a gardener)
How do you get it
That's very cool

PLEASE!!! This would make building in a survival setting so much better without having to introduce new bocks or mechanics, and could add some really interesting mechanics to Minecraft maps. It increases the capability for creativity in builds, and lets players use blocks and ideas that would normally be inaccessible. There is little to no reason not to do this, and it would mesh great with things that are already in the game. It could be craftable with blaze rods and echo shards which would work wonderfully with the lore of ancient cities having been made by a lost race of builders. It could also be a rare loot drop from some loot table, for example the ancient cities again would be great, but it could also work to expand the loot tables for dungeons, end cities, archeology and suspicious sand/gravel, or any other place where they would fit. This would be so greatly appreciated by the building community, and would fit great in what has been a series of updates focused around interesting game mechanics and further customization. Please Mojang, make the debug stick or something like it attainable in survival.

Copy of a different user's comment on the same topic:

It could be used to alter block states for decorative factors of builds. There is no way to light a furnace in a purely decorative fashion (without wasting anything), and there is no way to separate fence posts & walls or open barrels without the GUI in non-creative mode builds. The only way to get it is through cheats, which (in survival mode) are, well, cheating. It would remove some of the biggest limitations of some of the (potentially) most useful blocks (fences, stairs, walls, and observers) in survival builds. I am open to a more limited version, and a chance that by enchanting a stick you will get something less useful instead.

It would also be used in harmless jokes, (ie. flipping all your friend's torches around so they are not attached to the wall, or turning their furnace backwards) trap disarming/detecting, (by changing the block state of the pressure plate, which could be countered with an observer) and protecting your bed from villagers. (occupied=true)

It would not be too overpowered because you would have to get an enchanting table first, and (more often than not) you can't significantly affect block functionality. (like making a furnace cook without fuel) it also does not have combat application because (from what I know) it does not affect mobs.
The problem is you can fall into the void and once your done with one island it is hard to get to another
The risk of falling into the void when mining makes it all that much more interesting in my opinion.
Check out my "Second Material Progression" post this same idea is part of it
still pending approval rn, btw
You should add a farming update adding, for example cantaloupe, oranges, lettuce, etc. it would a lot more stuff to farming and I feel like a lot of other players would like it .
The idea come from systemZee ?
Yeah, it would be nice to have another tool that uses copper other than the telescope which can be used to rotate directional blocks.
It would be like the debug stick but for survival

Was actually about to post this idea: got it from the Supplementaries mod. It really just makes sense... (squints at observers and pistons and every other directional block ever)
 
Wrench (from April 3, 2022) has the same premise and 9 votes. "wrench for minecraft" (March 26, 2022) is also the same and has 5 votes. Only noting because duplicate should be combined with this one to get the real numbers.
Amazing I was thinking the same thing it would be so amazing it is already an ore so why not make armor with it and swords probably even shields
That is a great idea!

I love these, but #1 seems a but out of place, i feel as though the trident right now is good enough, and #15 seems a little overpowered, maybe if it was tweaked to be a little weaker, (like they only are revealed if they make noise and has a shorter range) then it would be better.

Here are some more ideas that might help you in huge caves and cliffs:

1) Dynamites

2) Mining helmet

3) Biomes: gassy caves, icy caves, slimy caves, and also scary caves

4) Hammer: used as a melee weapon and also break things like furnaces or smoker and more into their resources which required to craft them. For example, if you break a furnace with a hammer it will give you 8 cobblestones instead of furnace.

think of more ideas that can be useful and be added into Minecraft.

what they need to do is nerf iron armor and diamond armour and make netherite the only one with full Armour bars, not create some redundant emerald amour which makes no sense. I think that the development team wants to keep emeralds as currency and nothing more.
it would be too hard to get bc emerald ore only generates in clumps of 1
i think its a good idea becuse it hard to get and its strong
it would be really good because it is harder to find than diamond.
they NEED to add this it whould be so good for tools to
for me, the spear could still be thrown and creating it would look like this: a stick on the bottom, a stick in the middle and a stalagmite on the top
great idea!

I was going to post my own idea for glow squid neon blocks but it seems like you've already beaten me to the punch! Since I'm here though, I might as well put out some of my own thoughts in.

- Instead of a flat texture like you suggested, my idea would be have tubes going through the blocks that shine a lighter color than the rest of the block thus making them lighter than other color blocks of the same color while essentially looking like a sea lantern but divided. This would subsequently solve the problem of black neon blocks you brought up with the lighter colors. As a bonus, these textures would be placed like logs and basalt, and thus would have both a top and side texture to play with.

- Perhaps extending on my texture idea you'd be able to craft individual tubes and place them like end rods and chains? Maybe you'd craft 16 of them at a time similar to panes and bars and then you'd be able to craft four of them together into a single neon block? Your suggestion for crafting seems rather hefty on the glow ink cost and I think if a single craft of 16 individual tubes only costed one ink I think that would be pretty reasonable.

Thank you for listening and I hope you have a good day and night.

In education edition there is something called "Hardened glass" this glass has a neon-like glow along its edges and looks amazing but isn't in the normal game. They 100% should add glow glass and make it the same texture as hardened glass. Honestly, I love how the glass looks and it could be used for so many different builds.
